titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Bettina Linn was a 1926 graduate of Bryn Mawr College. She received her master's degree in English from Bryn Mawr in 1929. From 1934 until her retirement in 1962, she was a professor of English at Bryn Mawr. She was also a novelist, and during World War II, she worked as a research analyst in the Russian division of the Office of Strategic Services.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of Bettina Linn. Included are materials related to the publication of Linn's writings, such as correspondence with agents and publishers and contracts; photostats and typed manuscripts of novels and short stories; clippings of reviews and other publicity materials; lecture notes on authors and literary themes; and a 1945 certificate of merit from the Office of Strategic Services.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
